title: Will Kent-Daggett
about: I am a full-stack developer with over two years of experience crafting responsive websites, creating database schemas, and designing scalable APIs, both as a freelancer for independent clients and as part of a development team. I also have several years' experience mining large data sets to generate programmatic art and music. I believe that beautiful design predicates elegant code, and vice versa; I am looking for jobs (freelance or full-time) that position me at their point of intersection.

projects.name: Sup
projects.blurb: Privacy- and simplicity-oriented social network that allows users to temporarily share their current location to a subset of followers. Comprised of an API webserver and separate iOS client. Built with Node.js, Express, and Objecive-C. Developed during Software Design class at Macalester College, Spring 2014.

education.name: IES Madrid
details: Semester-long study abroad program in Madrid

work.blurb: Design, build, deploy, and maintain websites for clients.

projects.name: Will Matsuda
projects.blurb: Portfolio website that uses the Tumblr API to download and sort photos according to tags specified through a custom admin panel. Built with Node.js and Express.

projects.name: Guilt Trip Management
projects.blurb: Simple static website for Minneapolis-based booking and management company.

work.title: Web Director
work.blurb: As Web Director (2012-2015), had sole responsibility for updating, designing, and maintaining the station's website. As General Manager (Fall 2014), managed the station's budget and oversaw a half-dozen managers as well as a staff of over a hundred.

projects.name: WMCN.fm
projects.blurb: Webapp for Macalesterâ€™s radio station. Features an admin panel for approving show applications, scheduling shows, and managing user privileges. Also features a custom CMS for DJs to post show playlists. Built with Node.js and Express.

projects.name: WMCN API
projects.blurb: Standalone API layer for WMCN's PostgreSQL database. Built with Node.js and Express.

work.company: Macalester College Media & Cultural Studies Department
work.title: Research Assistant
work.blurb: Collaborated with Professor John Kim to develop a programmatic art installation. Awarded a Wallace Summer Research Grant for Summer 2014.

projects.name: Timelaps
projects.blurb: Sound installation that represents current weather conditions at Lake Superior, MN as ambient music. Comprised of a Python application that mines realtime weather data and a Max/MSP program to sonify the data. Exhibited at Macalester College, Fall 2014.

work.title: Sound Design + Programming Assistant
work.blurb: Helped develop a Max/MSP-based sound installation as part of a project that was a finalist for the 2013 Minneapolis Creative City Challenge

projects.name: Lakeforms
projects.blurb: Dynamic, interactive public pavilion that invites visitors to learn about Minneapolis's urban lakes. The pavilion's physical structure is a digitally enhanced scale model of the lakes' underwater topogrpahy. Inside the structure, visitors can engage with ambient music derived from realtime weather data collected across Minneapolis' urban lakes using custom 'smart buoys'.

work.title: New Media Initiatives Intern
work.blurb: Used Instagram, Leaflet, Stripe, Flickr, and Facebook APIs to add various features to the Walker's award-winning website.

work.title: Gallery Intern
work.blurb: Helped plan and build a new cinema room and the summer 2012 exhibition space.

job.title: Assistant Professor of Media and Cultural Studies
